events.name: The Power and Potential of Robotic Process Automation
events.description:
Speaker: Tomer Schwarts, Solution Executive Consultant - APAC Solutions, NICE APAC
One of the hottest and discussed topics these days centers around Robotic Process Automation (RPA). RPA is proven to be a powerful, emerging technology that had helped many organizations to improve operational efficiency and saved the business up to millions of dollars.  Despite the buzz and proven benefits, many people remain fuzzy on understanding the specifics.
So what does it really mean, what does it has to offer, is there an eco-system around it, and how should you be thinking about it to be successful?
events.location: Ocean Financial Centre, 10 Collyer Quay, #16-01, Singapore 049315
events.group_name: Verizon Innovation Community Managed by JustCo

events.name: RubySG Meetup (May'18)
events.description: Hi fellow Rubyists! Come join us for our May Ruby meetup! NOTE: Please bring along a photo ID for building security. Meetup Programme: 6:45pm: Event Starts + Networking 7:00pm: "Learning About Rails Engines", by Weiliang from EngageRocket 7:25pm: "Why MySQL 8 is great for developers", by special guest Peter Zaitsev (@PeterZaitsev), CEO of Percona (see below for synopsis) 7:50pm: 5 Random Ruby tips, by Ted Johansson (@drenmi) from EngageRocket 8:15pm: Events / Hiring Announcements 8:30pm: Event Ends --------------Peter Zaitsev's Talk Synopsis: There are many great new features in MySQL 8, but how exactly can they help your application? This session takes a practical look at MySQL 8 features and discusses which limitations of previous MySQL versions are overcome by MySQL 8 and what you can do with MySQL 8 that could not have been done before.-------------- - Organizing a Ruby event or launching a product? Tried a new Ruby gem or framework? Tell us about it! - Is your company looking to hire Ruby developers? Please share with us (https://github.com/rubysg/rubysg-reboot) -------------- Thank to our sponsors and supporters! Venue Sponsor: Tech in Asia Food Sponsor: Silicon Jungles Video Recording: Engineers.SG (https://twitter.com/engineersftw) -------------- Organisers Mingding (@hanmd82 | hanmd82@gmail.com)Grzegorz (@arnvald | witek.gregor@gmail.com)
events.location: Tech in Asia, 9 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec Tower 2 #04-01 Singapore 038989

events.name: LIFE SENSING TECHNOLOGY

if you have an interest and passion in the wearable technology and wish to find out more and even create a business out of it.

Bring your passion, your desire to explore and learn, your commitment to excellence and your persistance to make things happen, we will share with you the inspiration, training, support and the tools for your deserved financial rewards in abundance.
Limited seats. Reserve early to ensure your Success in life and business!
Contact me via Wechat ID : Mychen1313 or Watapps to my mobile to confirm your attendant.
Mobile: +65 9853 0603 / +65 9856 4813

events.name: Kafka in Kubernetes & Streaming ETL with Apache Kafka and KSQL
events.description: Join us for our next Singapore Apache Kafka meetup on May 22nd from 7:00pm hosted by Grab. The agenda, venue and speaker information can be found below. See you there! ----- Agenda:6:00pm: Doors open7:00pm - 7:45pm: Charles Martinot, Grab7:45 pm - 8:30pm: - Nick Dearden, Confluent8:30 - 9:00 - Pizza, Drinks, Networking and additional Q&A ------ Speaker:Charles Martinot, Data engineer at Grab Bio:As a devops engineer, Charles experimented and ran production loads over the past 5 years with Mesos and Marathon, bare CoreOS and now Kubernetes. Now, as a data engineer in Grab, he works to find ways to make his teammates life easier by reducing the operational load they have to shoulder. Title:A highly available Kafka cluster in 5 minutes ? Running Kafka in Kubernetes. Abstract:We'll dive in the Kafka setup used in the Grab data engineering team, and see how running Kafka in Kubernetes relieves the operational load associated with maintaining Kafka clusters. ----- Speaker:Nick Dearden, Confluent Bio:Nick is a technology and product leader at Confluent, where he enjoys leveraging many years of experience in the world of data and analytic systems to help design and explain the power of a streaming platform for every business. Prior to Confluent, he led the data platform group for a leading online real-estate seller and was chief architect for a cloud-based financial analytics platform. His early career stretches all the way back through multiple data warehouse and business intelligence adventures to the green-screen days of mainframe banking systems. Title:Streaming ETL with Apache Kafka and KSQL Abstract:Companies new and old are all recognising the importance of a low-latency, scalable, fault-tolerant data backbone - in the form of the Apache Kafka streaming platform. With Kafka developers can integrate multiple systems and data sources, enabling low latency analytics, event-driven architectures and the population of multiple downstream systems. What's more, these data pipelines can be built using configuration alone. In this talk, we'll see how easy it is to capture a stream of data changes in real-time from a database such as MySQL into Kafka using the Kafka Connect framework and then use KSQL to filter, aggregate and join it to other data, and finally stream the results from Kafka out into multiple targets such as Elasticsearch and MySQL. All of this can be accomplished without a single line of Java code! -------- Special thanks to Grab who are our local organisers for this event. Don't forget to join our Community Slack Team (https://launchpass.com/confluentcommunity) ! If you would like to speak or host our next event please let us know! [masked] NOTE: We are unable to cater for any attendees under the age of 18. Please do not sign up for this event if you are under 18.
events.location: Marina One West Tower, Grab, 9 Straits View, Singapore
events.group_name: Singapore Apache Kafka® Meetup by Confluent

events.name: Gophers Meetup - May 2018
events.description: This time, we have a special guest from Google, Issac Trotts. About Issac - "I prefer to write software in Go whenever possible because of the fast compiler, good error messages, readable code, ease of refactoring, concurrency support, runtime speed, fast garbage collection, useful core library, and great tooling. I know severalother languages, and I use them when they are more practical for the problem at hand." Agenda:1. Go on Google App Engine.2. Off from the Races! Food is sponsored by getlinks.co
events.location: The Hive Lavender, 1 Kallang Junction, Level 6 Vanguard Campus, Singapore

events.name: Singapore Emerging Blockchain Technology and Investment
events.description: Hi Likers, Join us in a one-day event for high net worth and professional investors to access the ideal platform for discovering Australasia's latest tech offerings. Please register at their eventbrite page:https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/singapore-emerging-technology-convention-may-2018-tickets-41200133709?aff=eand Featuring special guest speakers and high-profile panellists, this convention will allow attendees to delve into the technology space from the perspective of family offices, sovereign funds, government organisations, the blockchain, crypto and more! The Singapore Emerging Technology Convention will feature: 12 special guest speakers and panellistsLive presentations from up to 15 of Australasia's latest, high-growth private, pre-IPO, IPO and listed technology offeringsAn insight into family offices, sovereign funds, government organisations, venture capital, blockchain and crypto within the tech investment spaceExclusive networking sessions with C-level executives This is your opportunity to understand how entrepreneurs and investors, family offices, VCs and fund managers are approaching investment in this space. Register now to join 500+ HNW and professional investors to discover emerging growth technology companies. Event Details:Date: Wednesday 23 May 2018Time: 9.00 am - 5.00 pmRegistration & Pre-Event Networking: 8.00 amVenue: NTUC Auditorium, Level 7, 1 Marina Boulevard, Marina Bay, SingaporeCatering: Lunch will be provided at the eventCost: This is a free event for high net worth and professional investors
events.location: NTUC Auditorium, Level 7 NTUC Centre, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore
